  • 11 Dec 2016
    Sumo Deadlifts, 325x1x1

    With my first competition only two months away from now, I've been focusing more on form than sheer weight, especially when talking about the deadlift. I've been working on pulling with a more neutral back and braced core, which makes it much easier for me to lock out my pulls when the weight becomes heavier. I used to pull with a slightly rounded upper back, which had no issue in terms of endangering myself, but...

    0.525 minute


  • 22 Nov 2016
    My First Step As an Economist

    My mindset has always been attracted towards mathematics, even as I became a Pomona College first year and Sagehen for the first time ever back in September of 2013. It was because of this uncertainty that I immediately declared as a Mathematics major during the same year. However, what caught me off-guard, and what I completely owe to Pomona's constant advocacy and encouragement of a liberal arts education, was my attraction towards economics as my...

    3.095 minute


  • 20 Nov 2016
    The uni Kuru Toga Roulette Mechanical Pencil

    I have officially fallen into a rabbit hole that I think I won't ever be getting out of: I have become a fan of mechanical pencils. Being completely honest with the internet, I have never had the thought that the quality of the pencil in my hands would greatly influence the duration and comfort of my writing sessions. I have always used and kept random pencils I found lying around or on sale because they...

    2.265 minute


  • 24 Oct 2016
    My Thoughts on Stressful Interviews

    Being a fourth year at Pomona College who is over a quarter through his final undergraduate year, I must admit that the element of solidifying what you will be doing after graduating is quite stressful. Specifically, it's stressful to balance both my academic performance in upper division courses and, in my case, my preparation when it comes to job search. I have already crossed the first big obstacle for my post-undergraduate life by deciding to...

  • 18 Oct 2016
    Why Did I Choose Jekyll?

    Jekyll Generates Static Websites. Static websites are popular because they are super efficient, extremely fast and usually free to host. Blogs, resumes, marketing websites, landing pages, and documentation are all good candidates for static websites. To understand the differences and benefits of static vs dynamic websites, follow this quick visual tutorial: What is a Static Website? Well, I guess it’s quite obvious that I really enjoy working with Jekyll — with good reasons — so...

    1.605 minute


  • 17 Oct 2016
    My First Post

    I have never blogged in my life before. Until recently, the idea of blogging had never entered my mind, especially when accounting for how busy I am as an undergraduate student at Pomona College. But I've realised that my experiences as a student, and the things I have accomplished as a student, both give me a lot to say and share to the audience that is the internet. So, here it is; my first ever...

  • 23 Aug 2016
    Sumo Deadlifts, 405x1x1

    Officially a member of the Four-Plate (415 Pounds) Club! It's quite fitting too, since this month marks me powerlifting for a total of eleven months (though I have been bodybuilding for many years before I completely switched to powerlifting). Now, next goal: The Five-Plate (495 Pounds) Club.

    0.235 minute


  • 08 Jul 2016
    First Max Test

    I had my first max test today! I'm actually quite pleased with my results, especially for squat. Though my squat:deadlift ratio is quite pathetic, I'm happy with how my squat max was over 225 pounds, since I've gone through two injuries (one shoulder-related and one ankle-related) that put my squat behind deadlifting. With a total of 840 points, I'm pretty excited at the idea that getting a 1,000 pounds total when I compete for the...

    0.465 minute


  • 02 Jul 2016
    Sumo Deadlifts, 320x1x2

    Today felt like a bad day. I was exhausted, I was mentally stressed, and I was hungry. I really wanted to be able to pull 320x1x5, but the second rep felt as if 320 pounds was actually 380 pounds. Everyone is going to have bad days. It's inevitable that days are going to come where it feels like nothing in one's workout routine is going well. It's even possible that one's warm-ups will already begin...

    1.03 minute


  • 29 May 2016
    Conventional Deadlifts, 320x1x5

    I must admit: Conventional deadlifting is painful. Though I love it and personally find it more impressive than sumo deadlifting, I believe the reason why I think this way is because conventional deadlifting is just so difficult for me. I feel the strain and the struggle whenever I attempt conventional deadlifting, even though the same weight feels much lighter whilst sumo deadlifting. With this in mind, I'm quite happy with my performance today of 320x1x5;...

    0.48 minute

    Apologises for the poor video quality; the video was literally sent to me via a text message. Regardless, you can see my deadlifting journey here progressed from the goal of three plates to obtaining a membership of the four-plate club (415 pounds). Form here is decent, though I do remember this set being a struggle to lock out confidently towards the last two reps. Oh well, I put in the work at least, and it...

  • 06 May 2016
    Conventional Deadlifts, 315x1x1

    Pretty proud moment in my powerlifting journey; because this was posted back in May of 2016 (via Instagram), it's best to provide some context. 315 pounds has always been a big goal of mine when it came to deadlifting; it just seemed amazing to be able to deadlift three plates (each plate is 45 pounds). Since this was before I knew of the existence of sumo deadlifting, this moment is considered a personal milestone in...

    0.44 minute
